TopicTitle: How do you make giant B9 Aerospace planes fly?

Articles.Content: Let's say i want to make a giant aircraft that is made out of the B9 giant square-parts, how do i make them fly? Normal landing gears aren't enough (they will break or be wobbly), and let's say we simply can't make it like a rocket.
Are you using FAR? Or stock? Also, struts are your best friend.
I don't think the giant B9 square-parts are meant to be flown like airplanes. You can build giant space cruisers out of them, but these only fly in space (obviously).

Are you using FAR? Or stock? Also, struts are your best friend.

I'm not using FAR. I tried struts, but they explode or get wobbly.
In my experience: Very slowly, wasting lots of fuel and requiring vertical thrust to not crash.

Giant square parts? The HX series?

Those things are supposed to be assembled in orbit as giant spaceship/stations, not built as one space plane and intend to take off in anyway. They don't even have wings yet.

That said, I don't think it is impossible to build a space plane out of those parts. Someone will come up with a way, as always with the creativity of KSP players.
